name: df-pt
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4
body: |- wceq(cpt, cmpt(s0, universe, cfv(ctg, cab(s1, wex(s2, wa(w3a(wfn(cv(s2), cdm(cv(s0))), wral(s3, cdm(cv(s0)), wcel(cfv(cv(s2), cv(s3)), cfv(cv(s0), cv(s3)))), wrex(s4, cfn, wral(s3, cdif(cdm(cv(s0)), cv(s4)), wceq(cfv(cv(s2), cv(s3)), cuni(cfv(cv(s0), cv(s3))))))), wceq(cv(s1), cixp(s3, cdm(cv(s0)), cfv(cv(s2), cv(s3))))))))))
bodyPretty: ‚ä¢ Xt_ =(s0 ‚àà ùïå ‚Ü¶(topGen ` { s1 | ‚àÉ(s2,((s2[Fn]dom(s0)‚àß ‚àÄ(s3 ‚àà dom(s0),(s2 ` s3)‚àà(s0 ` s3))‚àß ‚àÉ(s4 ‚àà Fin, ‚àÄ(s3 ‚àà(dom(s0)\ s4),(s2 ` s3)= ‚ãÉ(s0 ` s3))))‚àß s1 = √ó(s3 ‚àà dom(s0),(s2 ` s3))))}))
comment: Define the product topology on a collection of topologies. For convenience, it is defined on arbitrary collections of sets, expressed as a function from some index set to the subbases of each factor space. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 3-Feb-2015.)
